alert.note: Alert for Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:42PM EDT until June 01 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Muscogee County in west central Georgia... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 1042 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbus, Bibb City, North Fort Moore, Vista Terrace, Saint Marys Hills, Edgewood, Kenwood, Highland Park, Benning Park, Benning Hills, Avondale, Carter Acres, Rose Hill and Laurel Hills. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
